headline: McConnell, McCarthy Slams Greene, Gosar for Attending White Nationalist Event
author: Jackson Richman
sentences:
Ronna McDaniel statement on Marjorie Taylor Greene appearance last night at Fuentes event: “White supremacy, neo-Nazism, hate speech and bigotry are disgusting and do not have a home in the Republican Party.”
— Josh Dawsey (@jdawsey1) February 26, 2022
Other Republicans slammed Greene and/or Gosar for attending AFPAC.

Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) and House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) slammed Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) and Paul Gosar (R-AZ) for attending a white nationalist event.

“This is unacceptable.” pic.twitter.com/rw3U2MY50j
— Jake Sherman (@JakeSherman) February 28, 2022
Greene and Gosar were at the America First Political Action Conference over the weekend.
“As Rep Marjorie Taylor Greene and Rep Paul Gosar speak at this white supremacist, anti-Semitic, pro-Putin event, silence by Republican Party leaders is deafening and enabling.
As Rep Marjorie Taylor Greene and Rep Paul Gosar speak at this white supremacist, anti-Semitic, pro-Putin event, silence by Republican Party leaders is deafening and enabling.
It was hosted by white nationalist and anti-Semite Nick Fuentes, who, at the conference, praised Russia amid its military invasion of Ukraine.
“White supremacy, neo-Nazism, hate speech and bigotry are disgusting and do not have a home in the Republican Party,” she said in a statement.
“There’s no place in the Republican Party for white supremacists or anti-Semitism,” said McConnell in a statement to Politico on Monday.

He also said, “Our secret sauce here – it’s these young, White men.”
McConnell is not the only GOP leader to condemn Greene.
All Americans should renounce this garbage and reject the Putin wing of the GOP now,” tweeted Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY).

In a statement to Punchbowl News, McCarthy called Gosar and Greene’s participation “appalling and wrong.”
NEW.
